title: Physiology
description:
The study of the functions and mechanisms in living organisms.
Example: Human circulatory system maintaining blood flow.

title: Biochemistry
description:
The study of chemical processes within living organisms.
Example: Glycolysis as a biochemical process.

title: Metabolism
description:
The chemical processes that occur within a living organism to maintain life.
Example: Breaking down glucose for energy.

title: Homeostasis
description:
The regulation of stable internal conditions.
Example: Body temperature regulation at 37Â°C in humans.

title: Enzymes
description:
Biological molecules that speed up chemical reactions.
Example: Amylase breaking down starch.

title: ATP
description:
Adenosine triphosphate, the energy currency of the cell.
Example: ATP powering muscle contractions.

title: Respiration
description:
The process of breaking down glucose to produce energy.
Example: Cellular respiration in mitochondria.

title: Aerobic Respiration
description:
Respiration using oxygen to produce energy.
Example: Energy production in human cells.

title: Anaerobic Respiration
description:
Respiration without oxygen.
Example: Lactic acid fermentation in muscles.

title: Basal Metabolic Rate (BMR)
description:
The rate at which the body uses energy while at rest.
Example: Higher BMR in active individuals.

title: Digestive System
description:
The system responsible for breaking down food and absorbing nutrients.
Example: Stomach and intestines digesting food.

title: Peristalsis
description:
Wave-like muscle contractions moving food through the digestive tract.
Example: Esophagus moving swallowed food.

title: Bile
description:
A digestive fluid produced by the liver aiding fat digestion.
Example: Bile emulsifying fats in the intestine.

title: Liver
description:
An organ involved in detoxification and metabolism.
Example: Processing nutrients absorbed from the gut.

title: Pancreas
description:
An organ producing digestive enzymes and hormones.
Example: Secreting insulin to regulate blood sugar.

title: Kidney
description:
An organ filtering waste products from the blood.
Example: Producing urine to excrete waste.

title: Nephrons
description:
The functional units of the kidney.
Example: Filtering blood to form urine.

title: Hormones
description:
Chemical messengers regulating physiological processes.
Example: Insulin regulating blood sugar levels.

title: Thyroid Gland
description:
A gland regulating metabolism and growth.
Example: Secreting thyroxine.

title: Pituitary Gland
description:
The master gland controlling other endocrine glands.
Example: Releasing growth hormone.

title: Adrenal Glands
description:
Glands producing stress hormones like adrenaline.
Example: Adrenaline increasing heart rate during stress.

title: Insulin
description:
A hormone regulating blood glucose levels.
Example: Insulin lowering high blood sugar.

title: Glucagon
description:
A hormone raising blood glucose levels.
Example: Glucagon stimulating glucose release from the liver.

title: Excretory System
description:
System removing waste products from the body.
Example: Kidneys and bladder excreting urine.

title: Urea
description:
Nitrogenous waste product excreted in urine.
Example: Urea formed in the liver.

title: Osmoregulation
description:
The process of maintaining water and ion balance.
Example: Kidneys conserving water in dehydration.

title: Respiratory System
description:
System responsible for gas exchange in the body.
Example: Lungs exchanging oxygen and carbon dioxide.

title: Alveoli
description:
Tiny air sacs in the lungs where gas exchange occurs.
Example: Oxygen entering blood in alveoli.

title: Diaphragm
description:
A muscle aiding breathing by contracting and relaxing.
Example: Diaphragm moving during inhalation.

title: Hemoglobin
description:
A protein in red blood cells binding and transporting oxygen.
Example: Oxygen carried by hemoglobin to tissues.

title: Sensory Organs
description:
Organs that detect stimuli from the environment.
Example: Eyes, ears, and skin as sensory organs.

title: Neuron
description:
The basic unit of the nervous system transmitting signals.
Example: Sensory neurons detecting stimuli.

title: Synapse
description:
The junction between two neurons for signal transmission.
Example: Neurotransmitter release at synapse.

title: Reflex Arc
description:
A neural pathway for reflex actions.
Example: Knee-jerk reflex during a tap.

title: Neurotransmitters
description:
Chemical messengers transmitting signals across synapses.
Example: Dopamine affecting mood.

title: Cerebrum
description:
The part of the brain responsible for voluntary activities.
Example: Decision-making and memory in humans.

title: Cerebellum
description:
The part of the brain coordinating movement and balance.
Example: Cerebellum controlling posture.

title: Medulla Oblongata
description:
Brain structure regulating involuntary functions.
Example: Medulla controlling heart rate and breathing.

title: Endocrine System
description:
A system of glands secreting hormones into the bloodstream.
Example: Thyroid and adrenal glands in humans.

title: Pineal Gland
description:
A gland regulating sleep cycles.
Example: Melatonin secretion regulating sleep.

title: Hypothalamus
description:
Brain region controlling the endocrine system.
Example: Hypothalamus regulating body temperature.

title: Axon
description:
The long projection of a neuron carrying impulses.
Example: Axons transmitting motor signals.

title: Dendrites
description:
The branches of a neuron receiving signals.
Example: Dendrites transmitting sensory input.

title: Nervous System
description:
The system transmitting signals between different body parts.
Example: Brain and spinal cord in humans.

title: Peripheral Nervous System
description:
Nerves outside the brain and spinal cord.
Example: Nerves in arms and legs.

title: Autonomic Nervous System
description:
Part of the nervous system controlling involuntary actions.
Example: Heart rate controlled by the autonomic system.

title: Sympathetic Nervous System
description:
Division of the autonomic system activating the fight-or-flight response.
Example: Increased heart rate during stress.

title: Parasympathetic Nervous System
description:
Division of the autonomic system promoting rest and digestion.
Example: Slowing heart rate after stress.

title: Cochlea
description:
A spiral structure in the inner ear detecting sound.
Example: Cochlea converting sound waves to signals.

title: Retina
description:
The layer in the eye converting light to neural signals.
Example: Retina detecting light and colors.

title: Hormonal Regulation
description:
Control of physiological activities by hormones.
Example: Insulin regulating blood sugar levels.

title: Feedback Mechanism
description:
Biological process regulating homeostasis through feedback.
Example: Negative feedback in blood sugar control.

title: Thyroxine
description:
Hormone regulating metabolism.
Example: Thyroxine secreted by the thyroid gland.

title: Adrenaline
description:
Hormone increasing heart rate during stress.
Example: Adrenaline released during a fight-or-flight response.

title: Cortisol
description:
Hormone regulating metabolism and stress response.
Example: Cortisol levels rising under prolonged stress.

title: Hypoglycemia
description:
Low blood sugar levels.
Example: Symptoms include dizziness and weakness.

title: Hyperglycemia
description:
High blood sugar levels.
Example: Occurs in uncontrolled diabetes.

title: Cellular Respiration
description:
Process of producing ATP by breaking down glucose.
Example: Occurs in mitochondria.

title: Krebs Cycle
description:
A series of chemical reactions in cellular respiration.
Example: Krebs cycle producing ATP and CO2.

title: Electron Transport Chain
description:
A process generating ATP in cellular respiration.
Example: Occurs in mitochondrial membranes.

title: Glycolysis
description:
First step in glucose breakdown for energy.
Example: Glycolysis producing pyruvate.

title: Lactic Acid Fermentation
description:
Anaerobic process producing energy in muscles.
Example: Occurs during vigorous exercise.

title: Exhalation
description:
Process of expelling air from the lungs.
Example: Releasing carbon dioxide during exhalation.

title: Inhalation
description:
Process of drawing air into the lungs.
Example: Oxygen entering the body during inhalation.

title: Myelin Sheath
description:
Insulating layer around neurons speeding signal transmission.
Example: Myelin sheath in motor neurons.

title: Action Potential
description:
Electrical impulse traveling along a neuron.
Example: Triggered by stimuli.

title: Neuroplasticity
description:
Ability of the brain to reorganize and adapt.
Example: Neuroplasticity aiding recovery after brain injury.

title: Spinal Reflex
description:
Automatic response mediated by the spinal cord.
Example: Pulling hand away from a hot object.

title: Hippocampus
description:
Brain region involved in memory formation.
Example: Hippocampus storing long-term memories.

title: Amygdala
description:
Brain structure processing emotions.
Example: Amygdala involved in fear responses.

title: Photoreceptors
description:
Cells in the retina detecting light.
Example: Rods and cones in the human eye.

title: Olfactory Bulb
description:
Structure processing smell information.
Example: Olfactory bulb detecting scents.

title: Taste Buds
description:
Structures on the tongue detecting taste.
Example: Taste buds sensing sweet and salty flavors.

title: Mechanoreceptors
description:
Receptors detecting mechanical stimuli like pressure.
Example: Mechanoreceptors in the skin sensing touch.

title: Thermoreceptors
description:
Receptors detecting temperature changes.
Example: Thermoreceptors sensing cold or heat.

title: Endothermy
description:
Ability to regulate internal body temperature.
Example: Mammals maintaining constant temperature.

title: Ectothermy
description:
Dependence on external environment for body heat.
Example: Reptiles basking in the sun.

title: Hypothalamic Control
description:
Regulation of bodily functions by the hypothalamus.
Example: Hypothalamus controlling hunger and thirst.

title: Cardiac Cycle
description:
Sequence of events in one heartbeat.
Example: Systole and diastole phases.

title: Stroke Volume
description:
Amount of blood pumped per heartbeat.
Example: Higher stroke volume during exercise.

title: Cardiac Output
description:
Total blood volume pumped by the heart per minute.
Example: Increased cardiac output during physical activity.

title: Pulmonary Circulation
description:
Blood flow between the heart and lungs.
Example: Oxygenated blood returning to the heart.

title: Systemic Circulation
description:
Blood flow between the heart and the rest of the body.
Example: Delivering oxygenated blood to tissues.

title: Bohr Effect
description:
Hemoglobin's decreased affinity for oxygen in high CO2.
Example: Facilitating oxygen release in active tissues.

title: Plasma Proteins
description:
Proteins in blood plasma performing various functions.
Example: Albumin maintaining osmotic pressure.

title: Hemostasis
description:
Process of stopping bleeding.
Example: Platelets forming a clot at the injury site.

title: Blood pH Regulation
description:
Maintaining blood pH within a narrow range.
Example: Buffer systems keeping pH stable.

title: Permeability
description:
Ability of membranes to allow substances through.
Example: Cell membranes controlling ion passage.

title: Ion Channels
description:
Protein channels facilitating ion movement across membranes.
Example: Calcium ion channels in muscle cells.

title: Lymphatic Vessels
description:
Vessels carrying lymph in the immune system.
Example: Lymphatic vessels draining interstitial fluid.

title: Antibodies
description:
Proteins targeting specific pathogens.
Example: Antibodies neutralizing viruses.

title: Macrophages
description:
Immune cells engulfing pathogens.
Example: Macrophages removing bacteria.

title: T-Cells
description:
Immune cells mediating adaptive immunity.
Example: T-cells attacking infected cells.

title: B-Cells
description:
Immune cells producing antibodies.
Example: B-cells neutralizing toxins.

title: Cilia
description:
Hair-like structures aiding movement or fluid flow.
Example: Cilia moving mucus in respiratory pathways.

title: Gas Exchange
description:
Exchange of oxygen and carbon dioxide in lungs.
Example: Gas exchange in alveoli.

title: Blood Pressure
description:
The force exerted by blood on vessel walls.
Example: Measured as systolic and diastolic pressure.

title: Edema
description:
Swelling caused by fluid accumulation in tissues.
Example: Edema in legs due to poor circulation.

title: Hyperventilation
description:
Excessive breathing leading to low CO2 levels.
Example: Hyperventilation during anxiety.

title: Hypoxia
description:
Low oxygen levels in tissues.
Example: Hypoxia at high altitudes.
